description: Generic functions can typically take arguments of any type.

functions.description: Value as type `T`
First non-_NULL_ arg, or _NULL_ if all are _NULL_
_NULL_ if `x == y`, else `x`

description: Aggregate functions take one or more of the same element type as arguments.

functions.description: Number of non-_NULL_ inputs
Maximum value among `T`
Minimum value among `T`
Sum of `T`'s values
Historical alias for `stddev_samp` *(imprecise)*
Population standard deviation of `T`'s values *(imprecise)*
Sample standard deviation of `T`'s values *(imprecise)*
Historical alias for `variance_samp` *(imprecise)*
Population variance of `T`'s values *(imprecise)*
Sample variance of `T`'s values *(imprecise)*
Aggregate values (including nulls) as a jsonb array

description: Number functions take number-like arguments, e.g. [`int`](../types/int), [`float`](../types/float), [`numeric`](../types/numeric).

functions.description: The absolute value of `x`
The largest integer >= `x`
The largest integer <= `x`
`x % y`
`x` rounded to the nearest whole number; halves are rounded up
`x` rounded to `y` decimal places, while retaining the same [`numeric`](../types/numeric) scale; halves are rounded up
The ASCII value of `s`'s left-most character
Number of graphemes in `s`
Number of graphemes in `s` using `encoding_name`

functions.signature: replace(s: str, f: str, r: str) -> str
functions.description: `s` with all instances of `f` replaced with `r`
Substring of `s` starting at `start_pos`

functions.signature: substring(s: str, start_pos: int, l: int) -> str
functions.description: Substring starting at `start_pos` of length `l`
Values of the capture groups of `regex` as matched in `haystack`

description: Scalar functions take a list of scalar expressions

functions.description: `true` if applying [bool_op](#boolean) to `expression` and every value of `s` evaluates to `true`
`true` if applying [bool_op](#boolean) to `expression` and any value of `s` evaluates to `true`
`true` for each value in `expression` if it matches at least one element of `s`
`true` for each value in `expression` if it does not match any elements of `s`
`true` if applying [bool_op](#boolean) to `expression` and any value of `s` evaluates to `true`

description: Subquery functions take a query, e.g. [`SELECT`](/docs/sql/select)

functions.description: `s` must return exactly one column; `true` if applying [bool_op](#boolean) to `expression` and every value of `s` evaluates to `true`
`s` must return exactly one column; `true` if applying [bool_op](#boolean) to `expression` and any value of `s` evaluates to `true`
`true` if `s` returns at least one row
`s` must return exactly one column; `true` for each value in `expression` if it matches at least one element of `s`
`true` if `s` returns zero rows
`s` must return exactly one column; `true` for each value in `expression` if it does not match any elements of `s`
`s` must return exactly one column; `true` if applying [bool_op](#boolean) to `expression` and any value of `s` evaluates to `true`

description: Time functions take or produce a time-like type, e.g. [`date`](../types/date), [`timestamp`](../types/timestamp), [`timestamptz`](../types/timestamptz).

functions.description: Largest `time_component` <= `val`
Specified time component from value

The logical time at which a query executes.

**NOTE**: Users cannot define views with queries containing `mz_logical_timestamp()`.

The `timestamptz` representing when the query was executed.

**NOTE**: Users cannot define views with queries containing `now()`.
Converts Unix epoch (seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on January 1, 1970) to timestamp
`j`'s elements if `j` is an array.
`j`'s elements if `j` is an array.
Number of elements in `j`'s outermost array.
The elements of `x` in a `jsonb` array. Elements can be of heterogenous types.
The elements of x as a `jsonb` object. The argument list alternates between keys and values.

functions.signature: jsonb_each(j: jsonb) -> Col<(key: string, value: jsonb)>
functions.description: `j`'s outermost elements if `j` is an object.

functions.signature: jsonb_each_text(j: jsonb) -> Col<(key: string, value: string)>
functions.description: `j`'s outermost elements if `j` is an object.
`j`'s outermost keys if `j` is an object.
Pretty printed (i.e. indented) `j`.
Type of `j`'s outermost value. One of `object`, `array`, `string`, `number`, `boolean`, and `null`.
`j` with all object fields with a value of `null` removed. Other `null` values remain.
`v` as `jsonb`
